topics.body:
Hey; I thought of something; my mom likes geeky stuff but refuses to actually try any of it.

What I mean by this is that she enjoys watching tv shows about it, she thinks cosplay and such is cool, but she won't actually watch the shows or such.  She won't watch anime/manga/superhero films or play video games.  She won't even watch Ultron.

She grew up in the era when people legitimately believed stuff like DnD was satanic rituals or such.

Give me a definitive homerun introduction movie, book, game or such to get someone to try other stuff; something that is definitively across the board regardless of whether or not someone is a part of it's fandom definitively agrees will get someone into geek culture.  I don't mean your favorite manga or anime, but something regardless of whether or not you're a fan of you can definitively agree that everyone will enjoy.
